page.title: 02Bredwardine; River Wye.
page.content: The River Wye, here about 50 m. wide, flows diagonally through the area from north-west to south-east. A feature is the large meander surrounding Brobury on three sides; the river has eaten away a deep cleft known as Brobury Scar on the east side of the area. This part of the river bank is heavily wooded, giving place to cultivated fields in the central area and low water-meadows to the west. The river is subject to flooding, particularly on the Bredwardine side. The Welsh Water Authority, who administer the area, have instituted a warning system which enables farmers to move their livestock when danger threatens. The river effectively separates Bredwardine and Brobury, there being only one crossing, at Bredwardine Bridge.
